page.title: 03FOCAL POINTS OF NEWICK
page.content: The village has two main focal points, one, the Village Green and the other, the Church, set away from the shops and houses. The Green is crossed by the A272 and has always had a sprinkling of shops and businesses around it. There was once a pond and the pump was erected in 1897 to provide drinking water for the villagers. The Church, dating from Norman times, is sited where two Pilgrim path crossed, one E-W between the cathedral cities of Canterbury and Winchester, and the other N-S down to Lewes. Three other very lively centres which need a mention are the inns, the Bull, the Royal Oak and the Crown.
